reporting-org.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs

title.narrative: Protection services to Internal Displaced People (IDP) and host communities in Sheikh Daher Community Center – Lattakia

description.narrative: Since the beginning of the crisis in 2011, Syria has witnessed significant challenges in the humanitarian and security situation across the country, an increase in the destruction of civil infrastructure, and a marked increase in internal displacement. A number of catalysts, including insecurity, deepening economic decline and reducing availability of basic services have contributed to the exacerbation of the humanitarian situation over the past few years. Economic woes have been aggravated by soaring food and fuel prices, and disrupted markets, exhaustion of savings, contributing to the extreme vulnerability of people from all walks of life, including increased reliance on negative coping mechanisms. Although being largely insulated from the armed conflict of the current crisis, the standard of living in Sheikh Daher neighborhood has been deteriorated due to the large influx of internally displaced people (IDPs) into the governorate (447,442, being the fifth governorate in the country with more IDPs), putting a strain on the infrastructure and public services, such as electricity and water.As the case in many areas across Syria, the large influx of students into government-protected areas has demanded the need for short-term coping mechanisms to be implemented such as shift rotations in schools, as well as increasing the number of students in classes. The overall effects of the conflict and the internal displacement into Lattakia have greatly disadvantaged its community and therefore created an urgent need for intervention (708,062 People in Need in the governorate). Within this contextual analysis, the ONG Rescate Syria (as experienced INGO on protection) will work to strengthen and expand community mobilization, ensure children are better protected, and improve community self-reliance and economic resources. In the proposed project, Rescate will implement several programs inside and outside the community center under the following areas of intervantion: Economic Empowerment for persons with specific needs to avoid resorting to coping mechanism, Educational Support, and Psychosocial Support. The Community Centre will play an essential role in identifying the needs of the community and will create programmes and activities that respond to those needs. Besides, the Centre will ensure proper coordination with other NGOs and service providers in the operational area in order to bridge any service gaps. To ensure that all beneficiaries are properly matched with the necessary support and programmes offered by the center, a social worker will conduct an initial needs assessment for each new beneficiary.

receiver-org.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs
